title: VMs with public interface will be incorrectly counted toward the router limits

comments.content:
1. Find a lab environment. In this example, the lab has a "/28" public network. (picture 1)

2. Launch 10 instances in the public network. (picture 2)
Though launching instances in public network is not a recommend behavior and is not valid, it is used in this bug description example to demonstrate how instances spawned in public network are incorrectly counted towards the router quota.

3. Verify your router quota, which is "10" in this case. (picture 3)

4. Create private networks and create routers to connect each of the private network with the public network. but you can not create as many as your quota limit. (picture 4) 

5. When you create the 4th router, there will be an error message from horizon "Error: Quota exceeded for resource router". (picture 5)

In this example, your router quota limit is 10, but you can create only 3 routers. The public net work is a "/28" network. So, it looks like instances spawned in public network is incorrectly counting towards the quota of the routers.
